definitions.text: sound of any kind (especially unintelligible or dissonant sound)
examples: they heard indistinct noises of people talking
during the firework display that ended the gala the noise reached 98 decibels

definitions.text: the auditory experience of sound that lacks musical quality; sound that is a disagreeable auditory experience
examples: modern music is just noise to me

definitions.text: electrical or acoustic activity that can disturb communication
a loud outcry of protest or complaint
examples: the announcement of the election recount caused a lot of noise
whatever it was he didn't like it and he was going to let them know by making as loud a noise as he could

definitions.text: incomprehensibility resulting from irrelevant information or meaningless facts or remarks
examples: all the noise in his speech concealed the fact that he didn't have anything to say

definitions.text: the quality of lacking any predictable order or plan
